Description: Sherd of Attic red-figured pottery lid; interior glazed black; exterior: from centre, frieze of short tongues around join of knob; red-figure decoration consisting of female to right (saccos and front of face remaining) holding jewellery or cosmetic box and sash; white object at right break.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2128)
